SEARCH
Package gw.plugin.system

Interface ITestingClock

All Superinterfaces:
InternalPlugin, Remote
public interface ITestingClock extends InternalPlugin
Defines a pluggable interface for getting/setting the system time. The purpose of this plugin interface is to facilitate testing date-sensitive operations. In production, this plugin should not be enabled.
Author:
pdalbora

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    long
    getCurrentTime()
    Gets the current time, in milliseconds.
    default boolean
    isClusterWide()
    Returns true if setCurrentTime(long)/setCurrentTimeAsync(long) changes the time cluster wide.
    void
    setCurrentTime(long time)
    Sets the current time, in milliseconds.
    default ChangeTimeRequest
    setCurrentTimeAsync(long time)
    Sets the current time asynchronously.
    void

    Called during server startup.
    void
    stop()
    Called during server shutdown.

  • Method Details

    • start

      void start()
      Called during server startup. Transaction.runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable) can be used to write to the database.

    • stop

      void stop()
      Called during server shutdown.

    • getCurrentTime

      long getCurrentTime()
      Gets the current time, in milliseconds.

    • setCurrentTime

      void setCurrentTime(long time)
      Sets the current time, in milliseconds. If the ClusteringEnabled config parameter set to true it could take considerable amount of time to change the clock cluster-wide, and setCurrentTimeAsync(long) could be a better choice.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the current time cannot be set to the given time.
      See Also:
      • setCurrentTimeAsync(long)

    • setCurrentTimeAsync

      default ChangeTimeRequest setCurrentTimeAsync(long time)
      Sets the current time asynchronously. The default implementation invokes setCurrentTime(long) and returns a completed request.
      Parameters:
      time - the current time, in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      the change clock request
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the current time cannot be set to the given time.
      See Also:
      • ChangeTimeRequest

    • isClusterWide

      default boolean isClusterWide()
      Returns true if setCurrentTime(long)/setCurrentTimeAsync(long) changes the time cluster wide. The default implementation returns false for backward compatibility.
      Returns:
      true if the clock is cluster aware
